Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Ellie!  C'mon!  Over here!

Dialogue: No joke?  You're being transferred to the 19th as your first assignment?  Who the hell loves your ass downtown?

Dialogue: What's the 21st?

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: What d'you care?  You'll never know.

Speaker: brooklyn
Dialogue: Manhattan.  The Upper East Side, East 59th to 96th.

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Remember Curran from the Sixteenth? He posted a coupla months there on a floater outside the French embassy. He met Jackie Kennedy.

Speaker: brooklyn
Dialogue: Curran, that fuckin' noodlehead.  He probably wrote her up for letting her dog dump on Rockefeller's doorstep.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Mmmmmm-glimmmeee-kisss!  I'm so proud of you!  What the hell took you so long?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Hey, don't ask me.  Ask the man who put in the good word.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: If T.J. didn't push for me, I never would've made it.

Speaker: brooklyn
Dialogue: Bet your ass... I give you six weeks before you're back on the beat, Keegan, they got no room for hero cops...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Appreciate, that vote of confidence, Brook.

Speaker: brooklyn
Dialogue: Hey, am I supportive, or what?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: He left Elaine for that?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I'd like to tie her tits together.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: That wouldn't be too difficult.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I bet you think she doesn't have a brain in her head.  I bet you think the only thing he sees in her is one incredible, dynamite body...

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I love your husband, Ellie, but he's a real dork.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Yeah, but he's my dork.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Think I should put the skateboard in bed with him?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Too kinky.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Ellie, you know I think it's about time we got outa this place, get us a house of our own.  We can afford it now.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Amen to that.  The supermarket's full of assholes.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Take my advice, don't buy any...

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Mike?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: My ass if falling.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Your what...?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: My ass is falling.  It is.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I just saw it in the mirror, it doesn't look like my ass anymore.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Get in bed.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: What am I gonna do?  I jog, I do the exercises on TV in the morning... gravity...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You got a great ass!  I love your ass -- now get that falling ass into bed before it hits the floor.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Tomorrow, I start looking for our house... You love me?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You got no idea...

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Imagine... I'm sleepin' with a DT.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Hi... nice to see you... thank you... my pleasure...

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Glad I could be of help.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Claire!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Hello, Win.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You know Neil Steinhart?

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Of the filthy rich Steinharts?  Why is it Claire always connects with the richest men this side of Saudi?

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: This gives new meaning to the word nightlife.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: C'mon, let's get outa this lowbrow rag trade...  You don't mind, do you?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Mr. Venza...

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Skiddy and Kit?  I haven't seen them since that shitty pasta dinner on the cape.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: They've got two monsters now.  Both boys.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: And so what's with Steinhart?  Is it serious?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You didn't like him?

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Looks a little constipated to me.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: It's called "solid"... Nice to find someone you can count on, Win.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: The main floor stays public.  The side rooms we try to keep available for special functions like tonight.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: It's terrific Win.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: You still writing the occasional magazine article?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Occasionally.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Then c'mon.  Follow me.  The art's in the basement, you're going to get a privileged peek.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Just press the button all the way down when you're ready, okay?

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: Where's she go?

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Probably found somebody nicer... Kidding.  You're great.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: You're in overtime, Freddy.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I will... I promise...

Speaker: venza
Dialogue: You need money, you come to me.

Speaker: venza
Dialogue: Who the fuck do you think you are, raising cash without coming to me?

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Your ex-partner... I'm buying you out, Joey.  Read the contract. There's ample provision.

Speaker: venza
Dialogue: Fuck the contract!

Speaker: venza
Dialogue: Two years ago you were begging me for the money.  Nobody would've touched you...

Speaker: win
Dialogue: You're making an eighty percent return.  Which is what you wanted.

Speaker: venza
Dialogue: Don't turn away when I'm talking to you.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Grease and water still don't mix, Joey.

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Jesus Christ... are you crazy?

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Joey!

Speaker: win
Dialogue: Jesus...!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: T.J...?  Is this a joke?  Are you kidding me?  Give me 20 minutes.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Switch the light off on your way out.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Right behind you, T.J.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Did you ever hear the chatter. They're worse than fuckin' four- year-olds... Miller, let's clear this path here, all right?

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Blood bath downstairs.  The owner of this place is dead.  And I got a witness, and a suspect... Joey Venza.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Nice question.  I like questions like that.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Who's Joey Venza?

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Okay, let's find out what we know. Herd'm up and check'm out.  Anybody know more than gossip about the deceased or Venza, I wanna talk to them myself.  Go.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Keegan, go baby-sit the witness. Just sit and look impressive.  Make her feel protected.  And if you can get her boyfriend outa my hair, I'll promote you to fuckin' Joint Chiefs...

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Quit playing with yourself, Keegan. I know who you are.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: A Detective's supposed to identify himself.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: Are you in charge here?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No, sir...

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: I asked for the man in charge...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: That would be Lieutenant Garber, and he's very busy upstairs...

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: Don't tell me he's "busy".  I asked for an ambulance for this woman and...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Is she injured?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: You're not going to talk to anyone without a lawyer.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: She's not a suspect, sir, she's a witness.  Could I ask you to step outside, please.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: No, I will not step outside.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sir, I am just trying to do my job, it's standard procedure to question the witness alone.  Help me out here, could you please leave.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: I don't really see what that has to do with...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Neil, do what he says.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Please.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: I'll be right outside.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Can I get you a cup of coffee or something?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I've never seen anyone killed before.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It's okay... I've never been a detective before either...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We'll go slow.  Okay?  We'll get through it together.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: I don't know how you did it, but whatever it was, keep doing it.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I just sat and listened.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Safe and secure is how we want her. Until she I.D.'s Venza.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Venza's either going to skip or try to get to her and Venza likes it here.  I want her ass covered, 24 hour protection, but I don't want her to know there is any real danger.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I don't understand.  If there's any danger, why not just level with her...

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: T.J. your friend's a little dense. When she realizes there's a killer tryin' to shut her up, she'll be on the next plane for Tahiti... somehow I think my way is better.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Chief?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Why not Patrol?  They'd do just as good a job.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: When I want your advise, Keegan, I'll make an appointment.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I got a 'choice' at all.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You in this with me?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Tommy!  Goddamnit!  Get these skateboards off the goddamn kitchen floor!

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: What're we having?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: My special, scrambled eggs surprise.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Scrambled eggs surprise?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: So how'd it go?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Not great.  I've got a babysitting job for a material witness on a homicide.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: For how long?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: 'Til they pick up the perp.  Seniority gets day shift... You know what that means.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Well, I'll live with it, I've lived with it all my life.  My Dad was a cop, he said, "whatever you do, honey, never go out with a cop". So, what did I do?  I got a job with the cops.  Then I married a cop.  I probably gave birth to a cop.  Tommy!  Come over here and eat, it's hot.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Maybe you and Tommy should stay with my Mom.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Don't start... The only reason is that the neighborhood's shi...  ... crummy.  I just don't like the idea of leaving you alone here at night.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I can still use a gun.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Just keep it someplace safe, but handy.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Keep what handy?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: The gun?  It's in the upstairs closet.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: How do you know where the gun is?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I know where everything is.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Except the goddamn skateboards, which are everywhere!  I'd like to kill the guy who invented those things.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Lay back, Mack.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Lay back, Mack!!  What's this "lay back, Mack?"  Where does he get this?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Keep the weekends for us, huh?  Get a replacement for Saturday nights. That'll give us the weekends together.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: God!  Scrambled eggs surprise?! These are pickles...!  God!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Just "lay back, Mack"... lay back...

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: You remember Detective Keegan?

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: I do.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: I want to make sure that everyone respects the privacy of Miss Gregory's household.  You're limited to the outer vestibule, so you can watch the elevator, the kitchen, so you can get something to eat, and the washroom.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Not Koontz.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: We'd like to, just once, get a look at the entire layout, so we can evaluate security.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: This really isn't necessary.  The security in this building is about the best in the city.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: I'm sure you're right, Miss Gregory, but I'd consider it a favor if you'd let us look around.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Be my guest.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Guys.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What about when she goes out?

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Discourage it.  But stay with her if you can't.  Call it in first so we can have a car on tail.  She's agreed to travel only with her own driver and limousine... okay, let's check it out.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Pretty good.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: Why an I reminded of the Three Stooges?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Just about everything you'd want will heat up by turning this to ninety seconds.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Fuckin' A.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: This is my dressing room, and these are my clothes.  I understand your responsibilities... but I'd appreciate you staying out of here at all times.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sorry.  Just checking.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Straight ahead.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Hard to find doors in this place.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: ... Detective Keegan, I hope you understand how upsetting this is?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: ... You know, and I know, that the only thing standing between a life sentence for Venza and his freedom is my testimony at his trial...

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: Claire...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: ... He killed Win... he enjoyed it...

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: Win made his choices, Claire.  We all do --

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: And I'm making mine.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: You're dealing with a psychopath. He gets out of jail in ten years, or five... or ninety days, and you'll be looking over your shoulder for the rest of your life...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: What am I supposed to do?!  I saw one of my oldest friends get killed! And I saw who did it!  I can't just -- "let it go away"!!

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: Claire...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I like 'em toasty.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Good night, Mr. Keegan.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: You're here 'til what time?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm relieved at 4:00 A.M.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: When you're through with it, put it back, please, exactly where you found it, and don't use the library again.  I have to leave town for a few days.  Let's do everything we can to make this less of a trial for her, shall we?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Hey!  What the hell're you doin' to my car?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Changing the sparks.  They showed it on TV.  What d'you think?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I think television's a dangerous thing.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: It's twenty bucks in the bank.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Enough, Tommy!  C'mon.  Get out of there!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Hey.  The neighbors.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Let 'em eat their hearts out.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I read the article.  You didn't tell me she was so beautiful.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Well, actually, she looks better than that.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I've got to go.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: See you Tommy.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Okay?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Unbelievably handsome.  You look fantastic in a suit.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Nice threads Dad.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Yeah, I think so.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I'm not sure how this works.  I have to go out... is that all right?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Uh...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I have to pick something up before Bergdorf's closes, then stop at a reception just a few blocks away.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I think, maybe, that isn't such a great idea...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Lieutenant Garber said that in all likelihood there was no real danger, is that true?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Right.  That's true.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Can we go then?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm supposed to call in.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: There's a phone in the car.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Do you have another tie?  Something more conservative?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Oh... Yes... I don't have it with me.  It's at home.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: What's the number?

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus, what a fucking lunatic. Fucking shopping.  I don't see that we have much choice.  Jesus Christ.  Tell her she's a fucking lunatic.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: What did he say?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: He thinks you're being a little careless.  He made the point several times.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You live in Manhattan?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Queens... You know Queens?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: My father founded a music school there.  The Milton Gregory School.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'm supposed to speak at their tenth anniversary.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Nice.  Maybe you'll stop by... have an aperitif...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Maybe not.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Don't move it.

Speaker: perfume lady
Dialogue: Hello, Miss Gregory.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Are you nervous?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No, Ma'am.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Would you wrap it for me, I'll be back in a moment.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Could you come with me please.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Would you pick one out, please?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Beg pardon?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Since you're going to be my escort, you'll need a new tie.

Speaker: salesperson
Dialogue: Perfect.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Put it on my account, please.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I got money.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: If we had more time we'd work on the suit too.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You look quite elegant, actually.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: My wife likes this suit.

Speaker: traffic cop
Dialogue: Bring it in, close.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Jesus Christ.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm on duty.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: What kind of work?  Gigolo?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You can touch me, I won't bite.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Not too sure about that.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: CLAIRE!  Claire!  Darling!  Are you all right?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: My God!  I couldn't believe... my poor darling... and Win Hockings...! Antonia'll be so happy you're here, she says a "Lifetime Achievement Award" is like being invited to your own funeral while you're still alive...

Speaker: antonia
Dialogue: Claire...!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I wouldn't have missed it, Tony.

Speaker: antonia
Dialogue: You look so beautiful...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: This is Mike Keegan, the policeman assigned to protect me.  Antonia Bolt...

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Marge Woodwin, Antonia Bolt, this is Mike Keegan...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: ... Ma'am.

Speaker: antonia
Dialogue: And he blushes.  I like that.  Take good care of her.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Uh, yeah.  I'm a policeman.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: ... Hard?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Would you excuse me, please?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Would you consider leaving here pretty soon?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: People think I'm stepping out on Neil.  We're causing quite a scandal.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Hey!  There are crazy people here.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Let's get a drink.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Ah... I shouldn't... on duty.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'll have a spritzer, order something soft for yourself... I must go for a pee.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'll come with you.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I think I can probably do that on my own.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Gimme a spritzer, and a... vodka martini.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Make it a double.

Speaker: venza
Dialogue: Christ, you're one beautiful woman. I could kill you right now, but I'm not gonna... 'cause you're gonna help me.  You're gonna see me in a police line-up and say it wasn't me. And if you don't do that, someone will come after you.  They're gonna find you dead, with your face missing -- understood... Good... Because otherwise, it'd be this easy.

Speaker: venza
Dialogue: Now walk outta here.  And if you ever see me again... you never saw me before.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Take care of her!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Venza!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: But I got him!  He's in jail! Wasn't that the point...?!

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: You apprehended him after he gave himself up --

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It wasn't a bad bust.  He gave himself up because he knew I was gonna nab him.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Anyone who turns himself in makes a good case for bail.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Even Joey Venza?!

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: He's got a good lawyer, and he made a smart move.  We've got a scared witness and a suspect who proved "good will" by turning himself in.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What about when she identifies him?!

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: If she identifies him.  Where the fuck were you anyway, cowboy!  Venza was meat.  He walked right past you, and now we're the ones playing catch-up!  You better hope she identifies him.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It was my fault, T.J.  Fuck!

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: The real estate lady left, she couldn't wait anymore.  What took you?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Oh, some shit.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: What shit, honey?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You don't want to hear about it.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: ... Look at the fireplace.  You don't get workmanship like that anymore.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Ninety-seven five.  What do you think?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Honey.  You got him.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I don't know that Ellie.  He might get out.  Garber's not bein' straight with the witness, she could be in deep shit if she identifies him, and it's my job to convince her she won't be.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: She's got to identify him.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Because the the only way to stop crime is to identify criminals.  I can't believe you're talking this way Mister Detective -- I think she's got a lot of guts.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I think -- she's crazy.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I'd identify him.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I might stop you.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Oh I can see you've had a bad day. We'll see the house another time, okay?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No!  No!  I'm sorry.  Ninety-seven five right?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Where'd you get the tie?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Bought it.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: It's not your taste.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What did she say the down payment was?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: She didn't like the other one, so she picked this one.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: She took you shopping for a tie?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I had to follow her to a store.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: What's wrong with your paisley tie?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Ellie, it was a formal party...

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Excuse me!  You went to a party with her?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm her bodyguard, goddamnit...

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I know you're her bodyguard.  Did she buy it or did you?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: She bought it.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I don't know why she bought me a tie! -- She's a generous person -- and she's a nice person -- and I could be settin' her up to be killed... you want the fuckin' tie?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Next time you two go shopping, maybe you could tell her we need a new Maytag stackable, double-decker washer and dryer set.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: You want to see the bedroom.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Hi.  Just checking to see if you're here.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You all right?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm sorry about what happened.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Listen, that was my fault.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I shouldn't have listened to you, I should've followed you right into the "can" the way he did.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: If I had known I was going to have company, he was right next to me.  I think he heard me peeing!  I hate that, I am glad he's in jail.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Lieutenant Garber says when I identify him, they're going to lock him up and throw away the key.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I guess I'm supposed to do it in the morning.  Identify him.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sooner, the better.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: He said he'd kill me.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Big talk... Desperate guy.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Right.  How could he do that if he's in jail and they've thrown away the key...?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It's the right thing to do. Identifying him.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Claire?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Hmm...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You wouldn't happen to know what language they speak in India, do you?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Urdu and Hindi.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Yeah, what a woman.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Didn't do very well, did you?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Nope... never finished one yet.  I hate these things.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You were reading my Renoir.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: How did you know?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You put it back in the wrong place... Do you like Renoir?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: They're kind of fuzzy.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You know why they're like that...? He was myopic... going blind.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No kidding.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: So, this could be your last night, huh?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Could be, I guess.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I mean, we're both sitting here, and Joey Venza's in jail...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Yeah, I like that!  Where you go, I follow.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You mean to tell me, a mugger would stay away from someone because they walked a certain way?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Absolutely.  Look at this.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: That's the dumbest walk I ever saw!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No, no seriously!  There's a study done on this, you walk this way, the muggers are gonna single you out.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: And die laughing, because you're walking so stupid!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Hey.  This is my business.  Do I tell you your business.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Okay.  Let's just see if a mugger gets me.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: ... It was like... the minute I saw her... I knew.  She looked so damn adorable in a cop's uniform... puttin' on a big, tough act...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: So it was "love".

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Yeah.  It was.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: And "is"...?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: That's nice.  And you live in Queens?  With a child, and a dog...?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No dog.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I saw you with a dog, in my mind.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No dog.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: But "nice".

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Very nice.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What about Neil?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You don't like him, do you?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What's to like?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Tell it like it is.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You asked.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: He's very caring, in his way.  You haven't seen him at his best.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You could do better.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'll miss you, Mike...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: It was nice having you "watch over me"...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Yeah.  I liked being around you too... Claire.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Let's go home.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Good night, Mike.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sleep good.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: It's 3 o'clock in the morning. Where the hell have you been?

Speaker: koontz
Dialogue: I guess it happens, you know?  A chick gives you a ride in her limousine, the next thing she wants is to wear your clothes...  ... I heard he had her underpants on his head.

Speaker: koontz
Dialogue: Ain't the first time the taxpayers paid for a blow-job neither.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Let's get this over with...

Speaker: koontz
Dialogue: Okay, we're gonna have a line-up here...

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Good morning, Miss Gregory.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: It was my fault not Detective Keegan's, I'm sorry for all the fuss.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: You all ready?

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: Will this take long?

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: We'll see.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: They can't hear you, they can't see you...  Good luck.

Speaker: koontz
Dialogue: Okay, take a seat... you, put a couple phone books under your rear...

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Coming to bed?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Few minutes.  Want to catch the news.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Should I wait up?  We've got to get up early for the beach tomorrow.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'll be right up.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: They need me back in Miami, but I'd really like it if you could join me. The marlin fishing's supposed to be great off the Keys...

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: The change would do you a world of good.

Speaker: tv newsman
Dialogue: Denied bail, Joey Venza will remain behind bars at least until the time of the trial --

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: Hallelujah.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: At least now we can get on with our own lives.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Hey, not yet!  How many times...

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: God, it's freezin' out there.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Ah!

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Wait a sec.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Hello.  It's the Whip.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Ah shit... Yeah, yeah, okay I'm on my way in.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Goddamn Venza assaulted a taxi driver in the Bronx, thirteen months ago.  It's coming to court and the judge let him walk because of the pending case law.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Mike, take it easy...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Take it easy!  I set her up.  I saw it coming.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: It's not your fault.  Mike, please get off the case.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It is my fault!  I'm responsible for her!

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Did you hear what I said?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Did you hear what I said?!!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm due on at seven.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: We're not going to the game, are we Mom?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Sure we are, let's go!

Speaker: koontz
Dialogue: She's a little upset.  You're going to have to piss in a bottle.

Speaker: koontz
Dialogue: Sorry, I don't have any extras. Have a nice night.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I can't open it.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You put me life in danger.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No, you'll be safe.  We're gonna pick him up again...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: And then what?  I'll never be safe. I'll have to leave the country!  You can't protect me, and you can't keep him in jail!  And you knew that all the goddamn time!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Claire...?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You told me I'm safe?  I'm going for a walk in the park.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Claire, will you calm down?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'm perfectly calm, I'm a normal human being.  I'm going for a walk in the park.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Claire...!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Stop, will you?!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Let go!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Stop being nuts!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I trusted you!  I thought you cared about me?!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I do care about you!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: More bullshit!  More bullshit!  What kind of odds are they giving me?  There must be some kind of office pool.  One month?  A couple of days?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Easy... easy... I'm not gonna leave you alone like this...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm not gonna let anything happen to you...

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: There's somebody outside...

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Calm down, everything is okay. Ellie reported a prowler.  Probably one of those peepers who've been making this neighborhood such a pleasure...

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: We all look like hell.

Speaker: brooklyn
Dialogue: I'll come 'round in the car from time to time so you can get some sleep.  Just keep the shades pulled.

Speaker: brooklyn
Dialogue: Thanks for the coffee.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Thanks.  You're terrific.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I know I heard noises... the detective's wife...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I want you and Tommy to stay with my mother.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Don't be ridiculous... That's all I need, rubbing up against your mother and grandmother every day... I can take care of myself...  C'mon, let's go to bed... we all need some sleep...

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: C'mon, don't make an issue of it. Do you want the fucking meatloaf or not?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: D'you have to say "fucking" every other word?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: What was that?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You heard me.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Jesus, Mike, somebody's been feeding you a line of crap.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What're you talking about --

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I'm talking about I've been talking this way for sixteen years and now, out of the blue, it's vulgar!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Fuck.  What's happening?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Is everything all right?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: They called here after you left...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: She's okay.  Everything's okay...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I don't know you...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: This is me, Mike.  There's nothing else...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You don't wash your clothes at the Boulevard Laundromat... you don't pick up your kids from some crummy public school... what is this?  A fuckin' joke?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Okay, then let's make it easy.  It was a mistake.  Don't make me feel guilty now that it's over, let's forget about it.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Don't you think I know what this is doing.  I know you have a wife.  I know you have a family... I'm not asking for anything.  I don't want anything... Just please hold me I'm scared...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: All fucked up, T.J.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: You gotta get another tour.  We're gettin' too old for this.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I'm not saying it's your fault.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What did you do tonight?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I watched TV.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What did you watch?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I don't remember Michael, go to sleep.  You don't have to make conversation with me.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I'll make a reservation tomorrow for early dinner.  You can sleep till noon.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Hey, we qualify for the Senior Citizens Early-Bird Special... Did you see Tommy today?  He misses you...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Well.  This'll be over soon. Venza's such a nut job, we're bound to pick him up soon.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I'd like you to switch to the day shift, Mike.  To be home for dinner. Helen insists that T.J. be home for dinner... That's why he's on the morning shift.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Well, T.J.'s... seniority... and all.  I'll talk to Garber about it.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I already did.  I mean, I talked to his wife, and she talked to him...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You talked to his wife?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: My wife talks to his wife about what shift I'm gonna take?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: What's the difference?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Unless there's some particular reason why it feels better to be around her at night.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Is there, Mike?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: What, what is it?  Is it serious or what...?  Quit looking at me like that!  What's with this ridiculous silence?!

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Goddamn.  I never thought this would happen to me... you fuckin' sonofabitch...

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I just want you off the case.  Get off it, or don't come home.  The kind of "lady" you apparently prefer.

Speaker: waiter
Dialogue: We got some specials.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We'll be right back.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Let me drive...

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Get away from me... get away!  She means that much to you, you stay with her.  But you come back, you come back for me.  Not for Tommy, not for your mother, or your fucking job, but for me.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: And you are a lady.  I have so much respect...

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: You fucker!  Don't tell me how much respect you have!  You dumb mother fucking FUCKER!  Now get off this case or don't come home!!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Hey, T.J.?  Yeah, listen, I need a huge favor from you, man.  I know Helen doesn't like you to miss dinner, but I need you to switch shifts with me tonight.  Look, do it or don't do it, but spare me the fuckin' lecture, all right?

Dialogue: I know sweetheart... we have enough flowers here.

Speaker: doorman
Dialogue: No, no, sweetheart... not here... get going... Okay.

Dialogue: Have a nice day.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: He's okay?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I just gotta talk to her, T.J.

Dialogue: T.J. agreed to take my shift.  He knows about us.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: So does Ellie.

Dialogue: You told her?

Dialogue: Not exactly.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: What do you want to do?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You're tired.  Let me watch over you tonight...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Put it down!  Think about it!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Get on the floor!  There may be more!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: T.J.!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Live, T.J.  Please...!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Get security on the phone! Emergency!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Ambulance!  Ambulance!  He's got a heartbeat...!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: They're operating on him.  He's still alive.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: I heard.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: I heard a lot... Anything you want to deny, Mike?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It should've been me...

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Then it would've been her, too.  I don't know... but I gotta protect the Precinct, too.  You're on suspension, pending Disciplinary Hearings.  Don't hold your breath. And you're not to go near that woman until she's no longer under Police protection and this case is closed.

Speaker: garber
Dialogue: Is it "love," Mike?  I hope so.  I want it to be worth it, for your sake.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I'm going to visit my sister for a few days.  I'd like you to get your stuff out.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What about Tommy?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: He'll live through it.  They all live through it.  What a world, huh?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Was it Venza?  Did you get him?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: What a shame.

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: You see a couple of the parties that go on at this place, you'll realize that marriage is an institution whose time has come and gone.

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Little Scotty stays on Wednesdays, and every other weekend.  And know what?  Our relationship's never been better.

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Make it home, Mike...

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: This is the rest of your life we're talking about.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I have thought it through, Neil.

Speaker: neil
Dialogue: Call me if anything changes.  I love you, Claire.

Dialogue: Unbelievable, man, the fuckin' jogger... they found him in Atlantic City, totally drugged out and still jogging...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Hello?  Mike.  Where have you been?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You don't want to know.

Dialogue: I've moved into Scotty's... Good news about T.J., though.  Looks like that tough son of a gun is gonna pull through.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Oh, I'm fine.  They've replaced you with quite an entourage.  It's a regular "marching band".  You should see me on the street, you'd think I was the First Lady --

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'm taking them all out to Queens, as a matter of fact, right in your neighborhood.  There's an event at my Father's school... an anniversary... I thought maybe you could come...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'm going away after that, the next morning.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: When can I see you?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I don't know.  Garber's left orders here not to let you in the building.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Oh yeah.  When is it?  This thing in Queens.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Tomorrow night.  Can you come?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Listen, you're right.  Don't do it. I'll just... send you an address, okay?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: No really, it's okay, I've gotta go. I'm expecting some calls.  I'll be fine, really.

Dialogue: Tommy!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: How are things going, pal?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Okay, I guess.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: How about dinner tonight?

Dialogue: Mom and I got plans.

Dialogue: What "plans?"  You and Mom got "plans?"

Dialogue: She's taking singing lessons.

Dialogue: She's what?

Dialogue: She met some friend of Aunt Millie's who works for a record company.  He thinks she's got a great voice.

Dialogue: What!  What kind of pathetic line is that?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: We're gonna pass the street.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: You coming in?

Dialogue: No, I'm not coming in.  And if you'd rather go to a "singing lesson" than have dinner with your father...

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: We're not going to a singing lesson, she's just gonna start taking singing lessons.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: So, what are you doing tonight?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Shooting.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Shooting?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Yeah.  She says we gotta get used to being alone in this neighborhood.  'Bye, Dad.

Dialogue: Tommy!  The guy's a sleaze-bag.  She can't sing.

Dialogue: I don't think she can sing, either.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Take care, pal.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Aren't you supposed to aim at the head?

Dialogue: Mom, what's going to happen with you and Dad?

Dialogue: I don't know Tommy.

Dialogue: Hey, can we go to McDonald's?

Dialogue: Absolutely.

Dialogue: Hello, Claire.  How extraordinary that you came.

Dialogue: It was something my father always liked me to do.

Dialogue: You're planning to speak?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Not if you don't want me to.

Speaker: giddings
Dialogue: Well, of course, we'd be... honored...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Just putting in an appearance then.

Dialogue: Don't do it, man.  I love ya, but you're out of your mind.

Dialogue: What a memory.

Dialogue: Do you dance?

Dialogue: Do you?

Dialogue: Pretty bad.

Dialogue: Let's do it.

Dialogue: They guys treatin' you all right?

Dialogue: Yeah.

Dialogue: I've been doing a lot of thinking.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It wouldn't work.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'd miss my life...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: ... Don't explain.

Dialogue: How long you going away for?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Long enough.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: "To"... Forget about you.

Dialogue: I'll have to pack a lot of clothes.

Dialogue: Yeah...

Dialogue: Brook's patching a call through to you.  He thought he'd find you here. It sounds urgent.

Dialogue: He says it's your son.

Dialogue: The office down the hall.

Dialogue: No.  Nobody but me.

Dialogue: Hello?

Dialogue: I need you guys.

Dialogue: Venza.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: At my house...!

Dialogue: Call a cruiser!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: ... Mike.

Dialogue: It's Venza.  He wants you.  You, for Ellie and Tommy.

Dialogue: Move it!  Get the cars!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Koontz!  I need you guys!

Speaker: koontz
Dialogue: We'll call SWAT.  We'll get the locals.  Throw it!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No, I need'm now!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Go with him!

Speaker: koontz
Dialogue: My job is to protect you!  This is Koontz --

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No One-Seventeen, they'll fuck it up!  He told me not to tell anybody, to bring Claire and come alone!  He won't wait, he knows I'm two minutes away!  Koontz, please!

Dialogue: I can't do it, you know that... He's not gonna allow it anyway, Mike.  No way is he gonna let anybody walk out of that house alive, who can finger him.

Dialogue: Mike!  Don't go there...!  Then make them come with you!

Dialogue: They can't, they're assigned to you!  I'd do the same thing!

Speaker: koontz
Dialogue: Go get her.

Dialogue: Fuck it, man.  Our brother needs us. Let's go.

Dialogue: Go!  Get outta here!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Get OUT!

Dialogue: They're assigned to me, they'll have to go if I come with you!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'm not getting out!  GO!

Dialogue: Adams...!  C'mon, move it!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Turn off the siren...!

Dialogue: We get there, you get down, stay out of sight.  Don't get near that house.  Understand me?  Venza's not to know you're there!

Dialogue: Tommy?  Ellie...?

Dialogue: I'm not armed!  I'm the only one in here!  I can help you get away if you listen to what I say!

Dialogue: I'm comin' in the kitchen!  If you fuckin' shoot me, they'll come in here, and we're all dead!  You hear me, Venza?!

Dialogue: You made a terrible mistake, Keegan. You didn't do what I said.

Dialogue: Joey.  I want to help you out of this.

Dialogue: You should'a brought the girl.

Dialogue: I brought the girl.  She's outside.

Dialogue: Hold it...!

Dialogue: I'll prove it!

Dialogue: Claire!

Dialogue: Not another word until I tell you.

Dialogue: How do I know that's her?

Dialogue: I'll bring her in.  You let them go, and I'll bring her in.

Dialogue: Why should she come in?

Dialogue: She trusts me.  She'll do what I say.

Dialogue: Bullshit!  Prove it.

Dialogue: You're gonna have trouble seeing anything, so just come in, and straight down a long hall.  Then stand at the door so we can see you. We want to see your face and we won't be able to until you get to the kitchen door!

Dialogue: I get my hostage first.  No one's turned loose until I say so.

Dialogue: Let my kid go.

Dialogue: I'm not lettin' no one go.

Dialogue: Get that gun away from his head, or I'll keep her from coming in!  Put the gun on me, he can't hurt you! He's tied up!  Put him under the table!

Dialogue: Don't you fuckin' give orders to me...

Dialogue: Put him under the table or I'll stop her from coming in.

Dialogue: Under the table.

Dialogue: Be careful, Tommy.

Dialogue: Claire!  It's dark.  Watch your step.  Come slowly.
